Message.Title: HTML5 Firefox OS ecosystem.
Message.Msg: Mozilla's Firefox OS, the new open mobile ecosystem is a real threat to Android and iOS, currently there are more than 17 key operators spanning the globe committed to that mobile ecosystem. With current US sequester and the global recession, I think the future will be for that free open ecosystem from Mozilla foundation, taking into consideration how it's easy to build applications in HTML5 which is the default standard in many new web browsers.

Message.Title: Vringo Crushes Google per JMOL rulings
Message.Msg: PACER DOC 909 (Post Judgement Royalties). Defendant Google ordered to respond to Plaintiff's Motion for POST JUDGEMENT ROYALTIES in 15 Days. Goog also loses JMOL on Motions. 905, 906, 907. Clock cleaned
That is not a minor developments, almost all of Google's revenue is from ads utilizing their search engine, if companies start shifting away from it, then there is a huge threat to their future.
that's what they said when yahoo ramped up their search engine, then BING and what not.....GOOG has the best of the best talent to weed through this.....I have faith in GOOG.

VRINGO ANNOUNCES RULINGS ON POST-TRIAL MOTIONS IN I/P ENGINE VS. AOL, GOOGLE ET AL.
Message.Msg: Court Orders Defendants to Respond to I/P Engine's Motion for Ongoing Royalties by April 18 NEW YORK - April 3, 2013 - Vringo, Inc. (NYSE MKT: VRNG), a company engaged in the innovation, development and monetization of mobile technologies and intellectual property, today announced that the Court has ruled on post-trial motions in its wholly-owned subsidiary I/P Engine, Inc.'s litigation against AOL, Inc., Google, Inc., IAC Search & Media, Inc., Gannett Company, Inc., and Target Corporation (collectively, "Defendants"). This summary is qualified in its entirety by the Court's rulings.

Message.Title: Glass - Google's big hope
Message.Msg: As per recent news, Baidu, China's largest search engine, is developing prototype digital eyewear similar to Google's Glass. The product is expected to leverage Baidu's strengths in image search and face recognition. The product is already in the testing stage. Google is likely to come out with its product within this year. A company spokesman informed that the Baidu device ( called “Baidu eye”) will be mounted on a headset with a small LCD screen, and will allow users to make image and voice searches as well as conduct face recognition matches. As per reports, the much anticipated Google Glass can live-stream images and audio and perform computing tasks. Such concepts, are attempts to emancipate oneself from carrying laptops / tablets, and still be able to perform the searches on the net and stay connected. Even Apple is experimenting with a wrist device (instead of eyewear) to enable users to perform similar tasks. Technology companies survive on such innovations and it is possible that the funky looking Google Glass becomes the next big thing in the tech world. It is expected to be expensive, but with iterations and maturity, the costs may come down, and the product may, literally, change the face of humans. The patents related to these products / technologies are going to be astronomically valued. Other companies are likely to be on the lookout for opportunities for patent infringements lawsuits. Recently, a subsidiary of Document Security System (DSS) filed a lawsuit against biggies like Facebook alleging that it had infringed on its patents. These patents are allegedly the essence of Facebook experience. If the lawsuit holds, the value of that is likely to be unbelievable. Other companies like Marathon Patents Group (MARA) with lawsuit against Sony, Dell etc., and MGT Capital Investment (MGT) with infringement case against gaming companies, are also in the news. GOOG has to remain extra careful.

Topic.Title: Google has 22 days to Settle up with VRNG.

Continue to pay royalties, buy out or find work around? Afterall, a lot of Google's ad revs came from Vringo patents.
